CatDescriptText: J.D. Truxell, janitor, Library, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "Do you think a shorter work week is the answer to the job loss posed by automation?" Answer reads: "I believe they can put more men to work even with the machines.  I think automation is part of the answer, but not all of it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of J.D. Truxell wearing dark uniform HORNES cap, dark tie with tie bar, and light colored coat, standing in front of bus or trolley
